titles.title: To amend the Foreign Affairs Reform and Restructuring Act of 1998 to reauthorize the United States Advisory Commission on Public Diplomacy.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Ms. Watson moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1003.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

calendar.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Reported by Senator Biden without amendment. With written report No. 110-55.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 117.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 5/2/2007--Public Law. This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.) Amends the Foreign Affairs Reform and Restructuring Act of 1998 to reauthorize the United States Advisory Commission on Public Diplomacy through October 1, 2009.
